title: Which social science disciplines are the most quantitative? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would think economics would be, for several reasons. Foremost is that they have a lot of high quality data to play with. Another reason is that economics is by its very nature dealing in money, not more subjective foci like the human psychology, or cultures, or polity. Finally, their course of study to become a professional in their field is highly quantitative, so as a profession they are well prepared for quantifying.
